entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
25/12 Picks Happy Christmas Everyone!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-fifth edition:

Floor:
  • from .meh to .fabulous – OMG RAINBOW DIVIDERS IN CSS! (by the awesome, Chris Heilmann and Lea Verou)
  • adaptive backgrounds – Extract dominant colors from images and applying it to its parent.
  • Codecademy – jQuery – I intend to become a jQuery MASTER over Christmas.
Alex:
  • Thoughtbot Podcast – GIANT ROBOTS SMASHING INTO OTHER GIANT ROBOTS PODCAST
Ben:
  • GitHub Explore – subscribe to the newsletter to stay up to date on GitHub
  • Ruby 2.1 – Ruby 2.1: Profiling Ruby
  • Papers, Please – have some spare time during the holidays? play Papers, please!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
18/12 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-fourth edition:

Floor:
  • Open Source Programming Book for Kids – because awesome.
  • Learn CSS Frameworks on Treehouse – ain’t nobody got time for plain CSS these days.
  • Decoding “Almost Sinatra” – Remember Herr Haase bringing Sinatra down to a mere 7 lines of code? Let’s take a closer look!
Laura:
  • Hello Ruby – A very special Advent calendar by Linda Liukas.
  • SpaceCalNYC – Space! A nice app that plots every object observed by NASA’s space-based telescopes.
  • How To Not Be An Expert – Jen Myers’ talk at the GitHub Passion Projects
Alex:
  • Thoughtbot Podcast – GIANT ROBOTS SMASHING INTO OTHER GIANT ROBOTS PODCAST
  • Progress Button Styles – Creative effects for loading buttons
  • How I Built Emojitracker – Adventures in Unicode, Real-time Streaming, and Media Culture
Ben:
  • Grace Hopper on Lettermann
  • 33 questions – find questions which identify everyone on this planet
  • Guy Kawasaki “The Art of the Start”

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
11/12 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-third edition:

Andy:
  • On Array indices – Should they start at 0 or 1?
  • roar – Resource-Oriented Architectures in Ruby.
  • Architecture the Lost Years – Keynote by Robert Martin at the Ruby Midwest 2011. Still a must watch!
Floor:
  • kod.io – March 1st, Linz will host kod.io – a developer conference around Python, Ruby and JavaScript (and all its frameworks). Go check it out.
  • tmate – Instant terminal sharing ftw.
  • MiniCodeEditor – A HTML/CSS/JavaScript code editor in 230+ bytes!
Laura:
  • PythonTrek – Because who doesn’t love a Star Trek/Monty Python generator? Bonus: you can view all generated phrases on the official twitter account!
  • Are you a FontAwesome Pro? – So, are you?
  • –
Alex:
  • Drawing on canvas – Exploring canvas drawing techniques
  • Text-only UI sketches – Before sketching in that notebook, try writing out your UI first.
  • Sinatra Cookbook – Recipes for the Ruby framework
Ben:
  • TracePoint – An Introduction to TracePoint in Ruby 2.0
  • OpenEmu – play all your childhood games! howto build
  • –

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
04/12 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-second edition:

Andy:
  • Writing Better Specs – 10 Basic steps that help you write cleaner and more focused tests.
  • Demystifying the Ruby GC – The Ruby Garbage Collector under the hood.
  • Nerdbot 2.0 Based on Lita – Because robots are awesome.
Floor:
  • Arduino-Bootcamp – You REALLY want to attend the last Arduino-Bootcamp of the year, at Hotel Karolinenhof in Vienna, on December 7th.
  • List.js – Search, sort, and filter your HTML tables, lists, and more!
  • 24 Pull Requests – Giving back little gifts of code for Christmas.
Laura:
  • ExplainShell – Match command-line arguments to their help text.
  • FishShell – Because the 90s are back.
  • Mathematica – Mathematica now free for the Raspberry Pi.
Alex:
  • Free Programming Books – About like everything.
  • Which HTML color are you? – Why does HTML think “chucknorris” is a color?
  • Mature Optimization Handbook – Performance measurement and optimization.
Ben:
  • list of computer technology code names – Ever ran out of names for you projects or physical devices? pick a code name!
  • Blue Shell – friendly command-line matchers for shell scripting in ruby using RSpec.
  • How Github (no longer) Works.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
27/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirty-first edition:

Andy:
  • watson – Creat GitHub and Bitbucket issues straight from your source code.
  • Greetings from Flynn – A Flynn Demo and Roadmap of the open source SaaS.
  • Know your Ruby switches – Ruby’s -e, -n and -p switches for the command line.
Floor:
  • R2D – A gem for 2D graphics in Ruby. Under ‘heavy development’, but interesting nevertheless.
  • webfont icons – How to use webfont icons as bullet points in HTML5 lists.
  • Chrome DevTools – Get your Chrome DevTools basics right with this Treehouse course.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
20/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the thirtieth edition:

Andy:
  • Struct – Great RubyTapas episode on Struct.
  • Que – A queue for Ruby applications that manages jobs using PostgreSQL’s advisory locks. Yeah.
  • bundler_ext – Using gem and system installed Ruby dependencies side by side.
Floor:
  • Gitter – Chat. For GitHub.
  • Hacker School – Apply to the Winter 2014 Batch.
  • RoR workshop in Vienna – … we’re hosting one. Tell your friends/family!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
13/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-nineth edition:

Andy:
  • Gobot – Go, Robot, Go! Golang for Robotics.
  • artoo – Ruby + Robots = <3
  • Try ALF – Relational Algebra at your Ruby fingertips.
Floor:
  • Codepen – I love browsing codepens, like these cool Chrome logo’s.
  • Statistics Done Wrong – The woefully complete guide
  • GitHub profile decorator – Show off your ASCII skills with GitHub profile decorator!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
6/11 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-eighth edition:

Andy:
  • Writing a (Ruby) compiler in Ruby bottom up – step 29 – The Operators – Part 3: Operating on our newly minted Fixnums.
  • Open Data Index – The Open Data Index assesses the state of open government data around the world.
  • Setting up Emacs as Ruby development environment on OSX – Has a few nice tips and tricks for Emacs operators who write Ruby and Ruby on Rails.
Floor:
  • backbone – Check out this free Frontend Masters lesson, where Sam steps through an example using a model, collection and view together in Backbone.js.
  • gosu – Programming games – A 10 minute crash course with Patrick Huesler (Wooga).
  • jumpstartlab – Ruby tutorials ftw! <3

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
23/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-seventh edition:

Andy:
  • Wiener BEAMers – A new meetup in Vienna about Erlang/OTP Elixir & friends.
  • How to become a better developer – The write-up to his talk at the October vienna.rb meetup.
  • Raspberry Pi + Go = Robot – Follow Will on his path building a robot with a Raspberry Pi and Golang.
Floor:
  • GitHub Arduino – Fun! Displaying realtime Github activity on a full color LED Matrix.
  • Changelog #108 – The Changelog talking Exercism.io with Katrina Owen.
  • Europe Code Week – 25-30 November is Europe Code Week! Join the fun!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
16/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-sixth edition:

Andy:
  • Nyan Cat RSpec Formatter – Because… why the hell not?
  • GitHub and Government – Make government better, together.
  • Rubinius X – Introducing a different kind of Ruby.
Floor:
  • Ruby gems gone wrong – On inconsiderate gem naming, wholeheartedly agree.
  • OSS Perks – A listing of tools that are made freely available to open source projects.
  • RuPy – Couldn’t make it to this year’s RuPy conference? Thank Glob I wrote a recap.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
09/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-fifth edition:

Andy:
  • Boson for kids – The boson explained for children (grownups can watch too).
  • Applicative functors – you probably haven’t heard of them – What every hipster should know about Functional Programming (slides).
  • Weird Machines – Lessons in Instruction-less Computation, from the WOOT ‘13 conference.
Floor:
  • iloveopensource – And I’m not afraid to show it!
  • From Nand to Tetris in 12 Steps – Currently going through this, super interesting.
  • The Legacy of Web Languages – Compared to the web of old, the way we develop sites has altered drastically. Here’s how.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
02/10 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-fourth edition:

Andy:
  • shellcheck – automatically detects problems with sh/bash scripts and commands.
  • joblint – tests tech job specs for issues with sexism, culture, expectations, and recruiter fails.
  • Secret Token – Ruby on Rails Default Token Database detects if a signing token is known somewhere in the Internet, or not.
Floor:
  • sandi_meter – Introducing: a gem which automates scanning your code versus Sandi Metz’ rules.
  • GoogleVis – Frontwise sure knows how to visualize the Takedown Requests dataset from Google!
  • RubyConf 2010 – The Road from Ruby Hacker to Entrepreneur (by GitHub’s Tom Preston-Werner).

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
25/9 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-third edition:

Andy:
  • explain analyze – A tool for finding a real cause for slow queries.
  • ninjanine – A helpful guide for beginners an Rails Girls participants. Cover terminal usage, some Ruby tricks and hints what to do when you get stuck.
  • git-cal – For the uber nerd that wants to Git everything.
Floor:
  • Eat, sleep, commit – How challenging yourself to contributing to open source every day changes your life… for the better!
  • CODER – A simple way to make web stuff on Raspberry Pi.
  • codosaur.us – Adventures of a dinosaur evolving to meet today’s challenges. Or actually: Dave Aronson sharing his thoughts on writing ‘good Ruby’.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
19/9 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twenty-second edition:

Andy:
  • Emacs Redux – Return to the Essence of Text Editing.
  • Explain Shell – Explain what your command line parameters are doing, also see this to use it from your shell.
  • Codewars – Enhance your mind with coding katas.
Floor:
  • git-pissed – git pissed tracks any number of words across your entire git history. And that’s hilarious.
  • GitLab – Talking GitLab and open source with Sytse Sijbrandij.
  • Planet Ruby – vienna.rb regular Gerald Bauer doing fun stuff with the pluto gem: pluto.live.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
4/9 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the twentieth edition:

Andy:
  • Unit Testing for the Non-TDDer – Nice post by Bryan Powell on how he as a self-proclaimed non-tester was indeed testing, and started testing much earlier than he thought.
  • brave clojure – Clojure for the Brave and True. Yep.
  • mutation testing – Markus Schirp’s slides of his mutation testing talk (as seen at eurucamp and RedFrogConf).
Floor:
  • bootstrap-wysihtml5 – Simple, beautiful wysiwyg editors.
  • DevFest Vienna – The program for DevFest Vienna is up, go register (especially for the hackathon – vienna.rb represent!)
  • Confident Ruby – Avdi’s lastest brain child (Confident Ruby), is finished. Get your (e)copy!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
28/8 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the nineteenth edition:

Andy:
  • Solving the Puzzle of Scalable Log Processing – How Travis CI deals with the logs of AAAAALL the builds.
  • Puppet at GitHub – Will Farrington gives an insight on how GitHub uses Puppet.
  • Keynote PuppetConf 2013 – Why Did We Think Large Scale Distributed Systems Would be Easy?
  • go koans – For those who want to learn Go test driven.
Floor:
  • DevFest Vienna – DevFest Vienna is a three-day event designed for curious developers. Their Sunday hackathon is OpenHack-styled and aims to get Vienna’s user groups working together on projects.
  • GitLab 6.0 Released – My friends at GitLab released their latest version, with loads of improvements. Merge requests ftw!
  • unerdwear – Unerdwear created a special ‘nerdie’ for Rails Girls – a late summer MUST-HAVE. All profits will be donated to Rails Girls Summer of Code.

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
21/8 Picks!!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the eightteenth edition:

Andy:
  • rubygems-proxy – The first version of a rubygems-proxy that caches the Gems for your local network.
  • gemspec_deps_gen – Builds your project dependencies inside gemspec file.
  • rom/devtools – The perfect CI rake task.
Floor:
  • Kids’n’Tech – Kids’n’Tech teaches HTML code to… kids, obviously.
  • Git tips – … because there’s no such thing as knowing to many shortcuts.
  • Scala tutorials – Looking forward to the launch of scalatutorials.com, MOAR learning!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
14/8 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the seventeenth edition:

Andy:
  • Hyperloop – Short of figuring out real teleportation, which would of course be awesome (someone please do this), the only option for super fast travel is to build a tube over or under the ground. Read why it’s so tricky and how they want to solve this.
  • Maestro – Container orchestration for Docker environments.
  • Shell script ahoy – What I learned from other’s shell scripts.
Floor:
  • Complicated Mechanisms Explained – Complicated Mechanisms Explained in simple animations. I think this is just great.
  • Codepen – I really love Codepen’s team picks of great CSS stuff on their homepage!
  • Green slate – Now you too can drink the “we only hire opensource contributors” kool-aid ;)

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
7/8 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the sixteenth edition:

Andy:
  • We still don’t really know how bicycles work – Forget mysterious dark matter and the inexplicable accelerating expansion of the universe; the bicycle represents a far more embarrassing hole in the accomplishments of physics
  • docker.io – Docker is an open-source engine which automates the deployment of applications as highly portable, self-sufficient containers.
  • Mailpile – Mailpile is a free-as-in-freedom personal e-mail searching and indexing tool, largely inspired by Google’s popular proprietary-but-gratis e-mail service. Check out their fundraiser http://igg.me/at/mailpile
Floor:
  • Animated Opacity for Hangout Overlays – The Hangouts API team recently released a new feature in the Dev Channel of the Hangouts API, that allows controlling the opacity of overlays. Check out how Gerwin Sturm’s has been playing around with the code to create some awesome effects.
  • Never leave the terminal – Konstantin Haase shared this great resource. Go watch it!
  • #pairwithme – We’d love to experiment a little with pair programming sessions! For the next meetup we reserve 18:00 – 19:00 for pairing, with the talks starting at 19:15. Drop by at 6pm and we’ll hook you up with a partner!

entry.title: Picks / What the vienna.rb Team Thinks Is Worth Sharing This Week
entry.content:
31/7 Picks!!

In a little series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, funsies… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifteenth edition:

Andy:
  • HTTP v2.0 draft – The first release of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol version 2.0.
  • Simple API with Nginx and PostgreSQL – How to build a simple REST API using only Nginx and PostgreSQL.
  • Regex Cross­word -Bored by regular crossword puzzles? Then level up!
Floor:
  • warrior.attack! – Code Ruby to get further in this cute game!
  • Kindergarten coders – 4-year-olds are learning to program thanks to a new graphics-based coding language
  • Deconstructing MySpace – I like onextrapixel’s approach to destructing non-traditional layout
